data.author: Milton Friedman
data.quote: There ain't no such thing as a free lunch

data.author: Will Durant
data.quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then is not an act, but a habit.

data.author: Carl Sagan
data.quote: I think I’m able to explain things because understanding wasn't entirely easy for me. Some things that the most brilliant students were able to see instantly I had to work to understand. I can remember what I had to do to figure it out.

data.author: John Wooden
data.quote: Things easily achieved are rarely long-lasting or significant.

data.author: Isaac Asimov
data.quote: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.

data.author: Charles Dickens
data.quote: No one is useless in the world who lightens the burden of it for anyone else.

data.author: Carl Friedrich Gauss
data.quote: It is not knowledge, but the act of learning, not possession, but the act of getting there, which grants the greatest enjoyment.

data.author: Mother Teresa
data.quote: I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the water to create many ripples.

data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
data.quote: Don’t judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.

data.author: John Wooden
data.quote: Ability may get you to the top, but character keeps you there.

data.author: Malcolm Forbes
data.quote: Too many people undervalue what they are and overvalue what they’re not.

data.author: Eric S. Raymond
data.quote: A critical factor in its success was that the X developers were willing to give the sources away for free in accordance with the hacker ethic, and able to distribute them over the Internet.
